page.title: 06BISLEY BUILDINGS
page.content: Most of the buildings in this village are build of Cotswold stone. The majority of them are old. The Church of All Saints was restored in 1862 to its present Victorian look. At the time Roman, Saxon and Norman remains were found and incorporated into the present building. It has a spire topped by a weathervane. The church is surrounded by a large graveyard which ends at a lychgate. On the west side of it are two large houses."Overcourt" dates back to Tudor times and is reputed to have housed Elizabeth I as a girl for a short time."Jane's Court" next door was remodelled in the 18th Century. It has an unusual large circular building in the grounds which was once a cock-pit. "The Bear Inn" which was built in the17th century was once the court house and nearby is a lock-up used for overnight offenders.
